title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 3.11 - Doors and windows-item 3p
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 3.11 - Doors and windows-item 3p

State Regulations
(a) All openings to the outer air are effectively protected by: (1)
screening; (2)
effective electric screen
panels; (3)
fans or air curtains
which provide sufficient air velocity so as to prevent the entrance of
flies; (4)
properly constructed
flaps where it is impractical to use self-closing doors or air curtains; or
(5)
any effective combination of
paragraphs (1), (2), (3) or (4) of this subdivision, or by any other method
which prevents the entrance of flies. (b) All outer doors are tight and
self-closing. Screen doors shall open outward. (c) All outer openings are rat-proofed to the
extent necessary to prevent the entry of rodents. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
3.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
